links.label: LinkedIn (where I pretend to be professional)

about.title: ðŸ§  About (Warning: Contains Traces of Sanity)
about.body: I am a caffeine-dependent life form who accidentally learned to code. With years of experience turning perfectly good requirements into  beautifully broken applications, I specialize in creating bugs that are so creative, they should win awards. My superpower is writing code that works on my machine but mysteriously fails everywhere else. I have an unhealthy relationship with Stack Overflow and consider "Did you try turning it off and on again?" as a valid debugging strategy.

roles.title: Lead Developer (and Chief Bug Whisperer)
roles.description: Successfully convinced management that 'it's not a bug, it's a feature' for 15 months straight

roles.title: Senior Engineer (Junior Stress Collector)
roles.description: Mastered the art of looking productive while secretly googling 'how to center a div' for the 500th time

roles.title: Full Stack Developer (Full Stack of Problems)
roles.description: Learned that 'move fast and break things' was not just a motto, but a prophecy

education.degree: B.S. Computer Science (emphasis on the BS)
education.achievements: Graduated without crying in public more than 3 times
Watched every 'Learn JavaScript in 10 minutes' video ever made

quote: Great software is built on Stack Overflow answers, prayer, and the tears of junior developers. Also, rubber ducks are excellent listeners.
